metadata.title: CVE-2022-2639 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: An integer coercion error was found in the openvswitch kernel module. Givena sufficiently large number of actions, while copying and reserving memoryfor a new action of a new flow, the reserve_sfa_size() function does notreturn -EMSGSIZE as expected, potentially leading to an out-of-bounds writeaccess. This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalatetheir privileges on the system.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
